pull.title: test: remove strict restrictions on rpc_deprecated test
pull.body:
Removed the wallet restrictions for `rpc_deprecated.py` and added specific test case for the current deprecated rpc. 
`skip_test_if_missing_module` will skip the whole test when the wallet is missing, even if a part of the test is non-wallet related. This PR ensures that other tests not related to wallet can be ran and only this specific test will be skipped if there's no wallet 

For more context check https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/31278#discussion_r2011661090

events.body:

### Conflicts
No conflicts as of last run.

983b035

I would suggest updating the commit message according to https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#committing-patches

test: remove strict restrictions on rpc_deprecated

Removed the wallet restrictions for rpc_deprecated.py and added specific test case for the current deprecated rpc.
skip_test_if_missing_module will skip the whole test when the wallet is missing, even if a part of the test is non-wallet related.

events.message:
test: remove strict restrictions on rpc_deprecated

Removed the wallet restrictions for rpc_deprecated.py and added specific test case for the current deprecated rpc.
skip_test_if_missing_module will skip the whole test when the wallet is missing, even if a part of the test is non-wallet related.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -31,8 +27,13 @@ def run_test(self):
         # at least one other functional test that still tests the RPCs
         # functionality using the respective -deprecatedrpc flag.
 
-        self.log.info("Test settxfee RPC")
-        assert_raises_rpc_error(-32, 'settxfee is deprecated and will be fully removed in v31.0.', self.nodes[0].rpc.settxfee, 0.01)
+        self.log.info("Tests for deprecated RPC methods (if any)")
+        # self.log.info("Currently no tests for deprecated RPC methods")
comments.body: did you intend to leave this commented code?

comments.body:
yes, here the conversation https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/31278#discussion_r1998876768
I have modified the comments a bit to, I hope, make it clearer.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -30,9 +26,14 @@ def run_test(self):
         # Please ensure that for all the RPC methods tested here, there is
         # at least one other functional test that still tests the RPCs
         # functionality using the respective -deprecatedrpc flag.
+        #
+        # Please uncomment the log below when no deprecated RPC methods are being tested
+        # self.log.info("Currently no tests for deprecated RPC methods")
 
-        self.log.info("Test settxfee RPC")
-        assert_raises_rpc_error(-32, 'settxfee is deprecated and will be fully removed in v31.0.', self.nodes[0].rpc.settxfee, 0.01)
+        if self.is_wallet_compiled():
+            self.log.info("Test settxfee RPC deprecation")
+            self.nodes[0].createwallet("settxfeerpc")
comments.body: Is creating wallet necessary? It didn't seem to be earlier.

comments.body:
Seems to, if the wallet is not created the following error is thrown on the assert: `No wallet is loaded. Load a wallet using loadwallet or create a new one with createwallet. (Note: A default wallet is no longer automatically created) (-18)
`

Interesting, I was wondering why, ended up tracking down the conditional, makes sense now.

https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/c0b7159de47592c95c6db061de682b4af4058102/test/functional/test_framework/test_framework.py#L470-L471

which is due to:

https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/c0b7159de47592c95c6db061de682b4af4058102/test/functional/test_framework/test_framework.py#L158-L160

comments.body: The `skip_if_no_wallet` function updates the internal state of the `BitcoinTestFramework` class, which I wouldn't have guessed just by its name.

comments.body: I guess it could make sense to require explicit setup of any wallets in tests, but this can be done in a follow-up, probably best after the bdb removal

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -31,8 +27,13 @@ def run_test(self):
         # at least one other functional test that still tests the RPCs
         # functionality using the respective -deprecatedrpc flag.
 
-        self.log.info("Test settxfee RPC")
-        assert_raises_rpc_error(-32, 'settxfee is deprecated and will be fully removed in v31.0.', self.nodes[0].rpc.settxfee, 0.01)
+        self.log.info("Tests for deprecated RPC methods (if any)")
+        # self.log.info("Currently no tests for deprecated RPC methods")
comments.body:
My suggestion to use "(if any)" was to be able to just leave everything in the skeleton as-is forever. In the future only new test cases are added or removed. This should also reduce merge conflicts.

The suggestion was, but I am not sure if it was self-explanatory: (If not, maybe add a comment to not remove or otherwise touch the log line)

```
self.log.info("Tests for deprecated RPC methods (if any)")

if self.is_wallet_compiled():
  self.log.info("Tests for deprecated wallet-related RPC methods (if any)")

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -31,8 +27,13 @@ def run_test(self):
         # at least one other functional test that still tests the RPCs
         # functionality using the respective -deprecatedrpc flag.
 
-        self.log.info("Test settxfee RPC")
-        assert_raises_rpc_error(-32, 'settxfee is deprecated and will be fully removed in v31.0.', self.nodes[0].rpc.settxfee, 0.01)
+        self.log.info("Tests for deprecated RPC methods (if any)")
+        # self.log.info("Currently no tests for deprecated RPC methods")
comments.body:
Oh so you suggest to leave the `self.is_wallet_compiled()` conditional as a skeleton for other future tests?
And leave the log "...if any..." always not commented, so it's still valid with or without tests?
If so, I like the idea will apply.
